title.value: Autonomous optimization of neuroprosthetic stimulation parameters that drive the motor cortex and spinal cord outputs in rats and monkeys
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned multiple times throughout the paper, reflecting the focus of the research work.
title.quote:
Article

Autonomous optimization of neuroprosthetic stimulation parameters that drive the motor cortex and spinal cord outputs in rats and monkeys

extractions.description: The paper discusses the development of an autonomous learning algorithm that optimizes neuroprosthetic stimulation parameters in real-time to evoke movements in rats and monkeys, increasing the efficacy of neuromodulation treatments.

type.justification: The research involves real-time experiments and validations with biological subjects, indicating an empirical approach.
type.quote: We show that GP-BO efficiently explores the neurostimulation space, outperforming other search strategies after testing only a fraction of the possible combinations. Through a series of real-time multi-dimensional neurostimulation experiments, we demonstrate optimization across diverse biological targets (brain, spinal cord), animal models (rats, non-human primates).

name.justification: The paper primarily focuses on the optimization of neuroprosthetic systems and treatments, positioning it firmly within the field of Neuroprosthetics.
name.quote: Neuroprostheses interfacing with the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves are being applied to clinical treatment of paralysis...

name.justification: The research leverages Gaussian-process-based Bayesian Optimization, a machine learning approach, for optimizing neuroprosthetic stimuli.
name.quote: Here, we leveraged an algorithmic class, Gaussian-process (GP)-based Bayesian optimization (BO), to solve this problem.

name.justification: The research involves the application of neuroprosthetic systems to biological entities, which is a fundamental aspect of neuroscience.
name.quote: Neuroprostheses interfacing with the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves are being applied to clinical treatment of paralysis...

name.justification: The GP-BO model is the primary methodology utilized in the research for optimizing neuroprosthetic stimulation parameters.
name.quote: we leveraged an algorithmic class, Gaussian-process (GP)-based Bayesian optimization (BO), to solve this problem.

is_contributed.justification: The research introduces and applies the GP-BO algorithm in the context of neuroprosthetic systems, indicating a contribution.
is_contributed.quote: we leveraged an algorithmic class, Gaussian-process (GP)-based Bayesian optimization (BO), to solve this problem.

is_executed.justification: The paper documents the implementation and evaluation of the GP-BO algorithm in experimental settings.
is_executed.quote: GP-BO efficiently explores the neurostimulation space, outperforming other search strategies after testing only a fraction of the possible combinations.

is_compared.justification: The GP-BO is compared with other benchmark strategies such as extensive and greedy search approaches.
is_compared.quote: GP-BO outperformed both extensive (random) and greedy searches across the entire dataset, both in exploration and exploitation performance.

referenced_paper_title.value: Hierarchical bayesian optimization of spatiotemporal neurostimulations for targeted motor outputs
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced work is related to Bayesian optimization applied to neurostimulation problems, which aligns with the research methodology of the current paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Previous work supported the applicability of BO to selected neuromodulation problems to facilitate parameters selection. Nevertheless, these results have mostly been limited to offline simulations.
